Description.div:
The AggregateSupplyOfNonRequestedTag flag indicates that system should aggregate the supplies that are returned by the API unless specific tag information is provided in the input. If the flag is set to Y, supplies are aggregated irrespective of the tag information and displayed in the output XML. If the flag is set to N, supplies are returned in the output XML with the tag information.
Default: Y
Valid Values: Y or N

An enterprise can configure multiple allocation rule sets with different document types. If an AllocationRuleID is passed, the allocation rule set is associated with the AllocationRuleID is used to select Option.
Default: The allocation rule with allocation rule id 'SYSTEM' for the enterprise is used. If allocation rule with allocation rule id 'SYSTEM' is not found, Allocation rule with allocation rule id 'SYSTEM' for DEFAULT is used.
The AllocationRuleID passed must be valid for both the Enterprise's rule set and document type of the order.

Carrier service code. If transfer schedule is present between two nodes , the tranfer schedule's transit days are used to calculate the transit time, otherwise CarrierServiceCode is used for calculating the transit time.

Attribute.Name: CheckCapacity
Attribute.Description:
Indicates if capacity check of resource pool is required.
Default: Y
Valid Values: Y Y or N

Description.div:
Indicate if inventory should to be checked.
Default: Y
Valid Values: Y Y or N
If Y , either the DistributionRuleId passed or the organization's default DistributionRuleId is used to obtain a distribution rule for supply and demand filtering for the availability calculations.
If N , either the DistributionRuleId passed or the organization's default DistributionRuleId is used to obtain a distribution rule for inventory availability. No supply or demand is read. Distribution drives inventory availability calculations.

The ConsiderCurrentSlot flag indicates that system should consider the available capacity of the current slots, which the current timestamp falls under.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Attribute.Name: ConsiderShipNodeCapacityForProcurement
Attribute.Description:
Indicates if capacity for procurements will be considered at ship node and procurement node both. If the ConsiderShipNodeCapacityForProcurement attribute is not passed in the input or passed as blank, the ConsiderShipNodeCapacityForProcurement attribute of YFS_SOURCING_CONFIG table will be used. Otherwise it will override the ConsiderShipNodeCapacityForProcurement attribute of YFS_SOURCING_CONFIG table.
Valid Values: Y or N

Description.div:
The ConsiderSupplementalCapacity flag indicates that supplemental capacity should also be considered when computing the availability of the resource pools which can serve the service lines.
If ConsiderSupplementalCapacity flag is not passed as Y , then the value of the CanConsumeSupplementalCapacity attribute of the customer (if provided) will be used.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
Indicates the Customer ID on which behalf inquiry is being made. Customer preferences are used in capacity computations.

A flag to determine if inventory options should be based on DeliveryDate or ShipDate.
Default: Y
Valid Values: Y Y or N
If DeliveryDateBased
is passed as Y , base options on DeliveryDate.
If DeliveryDateBased
is passed as N , base options on ShipDate.

Specifies a DemandType used in the inventory availability calculations.
Default: OPEN_ORDER
Only valid SupplyTypes that can be consumed against the DemandType value are considered in the inventory availability calculations.

If multiple lines are provided in the criteria, the value of the DependencyShippingRule indicates how the lines are dependent on each other. If the DependencyShippingRule is not passed, no dependency rule is applied to the lines.
Valid values:
01 - Ship together. This choice causes the resulting Options to have inventory from the same ShipNode.
02 - Deliver together.

Flag to determine possible Carrier Services.
Valid Values: Y or N
Default: N
Flag is used to determine store or return center for return fulfillment. Default value of flag is N. Valid values Y or N.
Indicates radius within which nodes can be considered for final leg sourcing. If distance between shipping node and ship to address is greater than this distance, node will not be used for sourcing.
Indicates radius unit of measure.

An ID that identifies an distribution rule, which can be used in inventory processing.
If the DistributionRuleId is passed, supplies and demands are read by applying the associated distribution rule filter.
If the DistributionRuleId is not passed, the Organization's default DistributionRuleId is used.
The EnterpriseCode on which behalf inquiry is being made. If not passed OrganizationCode primary enterprise will be used.
The minimum order line quantity that must be fulfilled in an order release before it is shipped
Depicts the method of fulfilling the order line during scheduling. This field can be matched with the corresponding field in YFS_Sourcing_Rule_Hdr table and appropriate sourcing rule can be selected.

Flag to ignore Minimum Notification time associated with Item and Shipnode.
Valid Values: Y or N

If IgnorePromised is passed as Y , promised demands are not considered during inventory availability calculations.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

If IgnoreUnpromised is passed as Y , unpromised demands are not considered during inventory availability calculations.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Flag to indicates whether the findInventory call was from an update api(scheduleOrder,createOrder,changeOrder,releaseOrder).
Valid Values: Y or N

Flag to indicates whether inventory can be partially promised against substitute and partially against original item. On the order this flag will always be N.
Valid Values: Y or N

Flag to indicate if substitution is allowed for Items.
Valid Values: Y or N
Determines the level of service to be used for the lines if not passed on the lines.

Positive integer used to determine the maximum number of possible solutions to find. Passing this attribute may improve best solution found, but may impact the performance of this api.
Default: 5
Valid positive integer.

This value determines the optimization rules to be applied to the scheduling process.
Default: 01

Inventory is being checked on behalf of the organization specified by OrganizationCode.
Must be an existing Organization.
OrganizationCode is not passed

If the AllocationRule's UseGeography flag is set to Y , the ReceivingNode's location is used to calculate the priority of the Option.
Must be an existing ReceivingNode.
End Date upto which to look inventory
Start Date from which to look inventory
Flag to indicate if Multiple Service Slots be returned by the api. If not passed, the value is set to N. In the output, Slots and AvailableDates element is shown only if this flag is passed as Y

The ReturnSlotsWithUnavailableCapacity flag indicates that slots with unavailable capacity should be returned in the output XML.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
Carrier to be used
Scac And Service Key
Inventory segment
Inventory Segment type

Shipping node from which the inventory should be found. This shipnode will be used when:
1. ShipNode attribute on promise line is not provided.
2. Multiple shipnodes on promise line are not provided.
Indicates if promise lines should be shipped (Checked for availability) in ratio. If set to Y, KitQty under Promise Line should be passed. Decimal Ratios are not allowed.
Used for sourcing rule determination.

Attribute.Name: UseItemCost
Attribute.Description:
Indicates if Item cost calculation is required. If the UseItemCost flag is not passed in input or passed as blank, the UseItemCost attribute of YFS_SOURCING_CONFIG table will be used. Otherwise it will override the UseItemCost attribute of YFS_SOURCING_CONFIG table.
Valid Values:
or N or Y

Attribute.Name: UseLandedCost
Attribute.Description:
Indicates if Landed cost calculation is required
Default: Y
Valid Values: Y Y or N

Description.div:
The UseUnplannedInventory flag indicates that system should assume that there is available unplanned inventory (inventory for which assumes to be available on current date + item's lead time) for any unavailable quantities. If the UseUnplannedInventory flag is passed, it will override the UseUnplannedInventory attribute on the item in the catalog. Otherwise, the UseUnplannedInventory attribute on the item will be used.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Multiple shipnodes can be passed for promise header and promise lines/promise service lines.
For promise header, multiple shipnodes will be used when:
1. ShipNode attribute on promise line/promise service line is not provided.
2. Multiple shipnodes on promise line/promise service line are not provided.
3. ShipNode attribute on promise header is not provided.
For promise line/promise service line, multiple shipnodes will be used when:
1. ShipNode attribute on promise line/promise service line is not provided.
If multiple shipnodes are passed for a DS line then the shipnode/s on the associated product line are ignored.
Shipping node from which the inventory should be found.

Multiple shipnodes that should be ignored during inquiry can be passed for promise header and promise lines/promise service lines. If not passed on the promise line, nodes from promise header will be used. If passed under promise line, then nodes at the header will not be used.
Node that should be ignored during the inquiry based on SupressSourcing ,SupressProcurementand SuppressNodeCapacity flags.

Flag determines whether to ignore inventory node capacity. Default: N. NOTE: If Node is blank and SuppressNodeCapacity is Yes, then inventory node capacity will be ignored for all nodes of the PromiseLine.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Flag determines whether to ignore ship node's capacity consideration for procurement for this order line.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Flag to indicate whether to exclude the Node for procurement consideration.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Flag to indicate whether to exclude the Node for sourcing consideration.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

This table stores order line information, including item details and shipping information. Multiple lines can be created for a single order defined in the YFS_ORDER_HEADER table.
Line is a bundle parent and child lines are automatically included based on the components of the bundle in the catalog, which contains a model item.
Unique identifier for the parent line.
DeliveryMethod used for obtaining the promise line. Posible values include Delivery DEL, Ship SHP or Pick Up PICK
Department Code. Used for routing guide determination.
Freight Terms. Used for routing guide determination.
This flag indicates if the line is to be gift wrapped. If passed as Y, the line availability is calculated from the shipnodes which support gift wrap services.
Lines with the same ID will be considered as a single shipment, given that ship node and dates are the same.
This flag indicates if forwarding for this line is allowed.
This flag indicates if procurement for this line is allowed.

Specifies a collection of items that form a unit. For example, a home theater system is a unit, or kit, consisting of components such as a VCR, a TV, a stereo, and other components.
Valid values:
LK
- Logical kit,
PK
- Physical kit,
DPK
- Dynamic Physical kit,
BUNDLE
- Bundle
Indicates ratio between the promise lines. This should be passed when ShipTogetherInRatio under Promise is set to Y. Decimal Ratios are not allowed.
Unique identifier for the line. It is mandatory to pass this attribute.

The preferred minimum ship by date of the available supply that promise line can schedule against. Available supply with ship by date earlier than the minimum ship by date will not be considered.
Default: None

Used to identify orderLine and corresponding orderline reservation.
Default: None
Node from which shipping node can procure inventory from.

Look for inventory between the ReqStartDate and the ReqEndDate.
Default: Current date
Must be a valid date.

Look for inventory between the ReqStartDate and the ReqEndDate.
Default: Current date
Must be a valid date.

Required Quantity.
Either RequiredQty is not greater than 0 or is missing.
Scac And Service Key
Shipping node from which the inventory should be found. This shipnode will be used first if provided.
Shipping node from which the inventory should be found.

Multiple shipnodes that should be ignored during inquiry can be passed for promise header and promise lines/promise service lines. If not passed on the promise line, nodes from promise header will be used. If passed under promise line, then nodes at the header will not be used.
Node that should be ignored during the inquiry based on SupressSourcing and SupressProcurement flags.

Flag to indicate whether to exclude the Node for node capacity considerations.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Flag determines whether to ignore ship node's capacity consideration for procurement for this order line.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Flag to indicate whether to exclude the Node for procurement consideration.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
Flag to indicate whether to exclude the Node for sourcing consideration.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
Customer should NOT use this element as it is developed only for internal promising server calls.
Quantity available from reservation.
Required for matching multiple reservations for same orderline.
First date on which Item is available.
Default value is N. Valid value is Y or N.
last date on which Item is available.
Reference to the orderLine the reservation was made.
Inventory Organization code for the reservation.
Quantity reserved.
The Requested reservation date.Should be passed always for external availability to work poroperly.
The reservationID of the reservation.
Node at which reservation was made.
ItemID for the demand.
ProductClass of the item.
Unit Of Measure of the item.

Element.Description:
Determines the filtering attributes when determining availability of a model item. This can be used to specify the correct style, size, or color of a model item and only include model children inventory whose item definition meet the required input.
Note: Only extended attributes of the YFS_ITEM table are supported.

Attribute.Name: GetUnpublishedItems
Attribute.Description: Indicates if unpublished items needs to be considered.

Description.div:
This flag indicates whether invalid items should be considered. Valid values: Y or N
Default value: N

Valid values are Y , N. If this is passed as N, required capacity is used as capacity to look for. If required capacity is not passed then required qty is used as capacity to look for. No association based qty calculations are done.

Item Group Code of the service line. Valid values are PS or DS.
If passed, the value must match the Item Group Code of the Item as defined in Catalog.
Unique identifier for the Line. The same value must be passed in the association node as well to identify the service line attached to the product line.

Look for inventory between the ReqStartDate and the ReqEndDate.
Default: Current date
Must be a valid date.

Look for inventory between the ReqStartDate and the ReqEndDate.
Default: Current date
Must be a valid date.
Required Capacity for the promise service line. Will be ignored if ComputeServiceQty is pased as Y.
Required Quantity for the promise line. Used only when capacity is computed based ordered qty for the service specified.

Resource Pool Key which should be considered during the inquiry. Once passed, no other resource pool will be considered. Also no check will be made if the specified resource pool can fulfill the request based on the address, skills, day of the week. Capacity will still be checked for the resource pool specified.
Shipping node from which the inventory should be found. This shipnode will be used first if provided.
Shipping node from which the inventory should be found.

Multiple shipnodes that should be ignored during inquiry can be passed for promise header and promise lines/promise service lines. If not passed on the promise line, nodes from promise header will be used. If passed under promise line, then nodes at the header will not be used.
Node that should be ignored during the inquiry based on SupressSourcing flag.

Flag to indicate whether to exclude the Node for sourcing consideration.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
Flag to indicate whether or not to populate data from Product Master tables. If passed, the ServiceQuantity and ProductQuantity fields will be picked from database.

Flag to indicate whether product will be delivered as part of the provided service execution. If this flag is Yes then ServiceTimeOffsetHours will be ignored. Delivery sourcing will be used if node is not specified.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
Unique identifier for the Product Line. The same value must be passed in the Promise Line node as well to identify the Product line attached to the Service line.
Specifies the product quantity for which Service Quantity is stored in Association
Unique identifier for the Service Line. The same value must be passed in the Promise Service Line node as well to identify the service line attached to the product line.

Specifies the Service quantity for which Product Quantity is stored in Association. e.g. Product Quantity of 12 and Service Quantity of 6 means 6 units of Service Quantity are needed to service (or deliver) 12 units of product.
Specifies the time difference needed in Hours between the delivery of the Product and performing the Service on it.
